root.name: Jungle Fever/Knight on the Town
root.description: BackgroundWhen adult-game company Mystique went out of business, PlayAround bought the rights to their games. Along with the original Mystique titles, PlayAround also released a number of their own adult-themed games. These games were released in pairs on special "double-end" cartridges.OverviewThe two games contained in this release are "Jungle Fever" and "Knight on the Town".Jungle FeverJungle Fever is a re-working of the PlayAround game Burning Desire (only with gender roles reversed). The game features a naked woman attached to a helicopter, hovering over a burning fire. Your job is to put the fires out and rescue a man (in the most graphic way possible) while avoiding stones thrown by restless natives.Knight on the TownKnight on the Town is an original game created by PlayAround. It features a knight who must build a bridge across the moat of a castle in order to reach the buxom maiden in the tower. This may sound easy, but deadly alligators and a really annoying goblin make things increasingly difficult as more of the bridge is built.
